title: A Civilized Complaint on a Few Recent Splashes.
body:
If you look at Ahri's original splash art, you can tell that her face is actually both taller and broader than the new one. The new splash, while it aims for a cuter and smaller look, ultimately doesn't make it look like the same person. Janna's splash art also suffers this but to a greater degree (she has a different body and facial structure in which she's too vertical and skinny : like a twig). Not to mention, I don't really know why Riot is trying to take an approach at making Ahri look less oriental. There's nothing wrong with trying to include every ethnicity in the game, but trying to change facial features for a different look on an existing champions simply makes a champion feel alienating to a player base. For example, if you look at any of Ahri's other skins then compare it to her new classic, it doesn't feel like the same champion. It would be the equivalent of trying to make a champion like xin zhao or Lucian have extremely "generic" facial features so that you could more or less not tell what specific ethnicity that individual is (for example, more beige skin, a generic eye structure, etc). I think most of the playerbase would understand this change of facial structures if this were a skin noncanon to the champion, but I think the defaults should do the original champion justice. Oh yeah, I think Ahri's splash might also look a tad better if you tried to make her lip color the same "beige" look as in her original splash art (but that's just my 2 cents).

http://fc09.deviantart.net/fs70/i/2012/255/b/7/ahri_splash_art_by_aveldine-d5ej1ds.jpg

http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-SVAAVXUMURo/VDwpN4GPLvI/AAAAAAAAbJw/zq1fLshfmrU/s1600/Ahri_Splash_0.jpg

And going back to Janna, the summation of my 2 cents is just that she look incredibly frail - like a stick. She's very tall, but also very skinny (both her body and her face). I also feel like the tattoos she originally had and her shorter, stockier look in her original looks better (Even Janna's noncanon skin, forecast Janna, displays Janna's physical features extremely well). I also don't get why she doesn't have pupils anymore. 

http://img2.leaguecraft.com/lol-splash-art/asset/wallpaper_760px_1522.jpg

http://i.ytimg.com/vi/hoMBVHCKloY/maxresdefault.jpg

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kAVW8jWV44E/VDwpOHJdPFI/AAAAAAAAbKE/xCjp3PlRVmE/s1600/Janna_Splash_0.jpg
And going on to Lee Sin, both I and much of the community agree that while the skin is very well done, Lee Sin's, um, head and facial features doesn't look as good as it could be. Taking from another's post, this individual changed Lee Sin's current splash into one that looks, to many opinion's, better:

http://i57.tinypic.com/sc45so.png

Those facial features that are a result of ethnic quirks and details in a champion are really what define the familiarity in identifying with said champion. For instance, when Vladimir came put with his new splash art a year and a half ago, it was extremely well done because of the same feel it held to the original. It ultimately did it justice and even glorified what Vladimir "felt" like and was welcomed by the vast majority of the community with open arms. While I feel like the newest array of splashes have done extremely well in doing so (such as Akali's newest splash art) I feel like some of the champions have lost a sense of familiarity to them with their new defaults such as Lee Sin, Ahri, And Janna.

http://www.leaguesplash.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/Vladimir-Classic-Original.jpg

http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/a49160828f039486cc81df08a6479c0d.jpg

For example, in this fan art of Ahri and Janna (done by Artgerm [Stanley Lau] who did Leblanc's splash art and the Yasuo sneak preview arts), I feel like he really captures the champions really well not just in terms of their themes, but most impressively the facial struture of different champions that suit the individual very well:

http://th06.deviantart.net/fs70/PRE/f/2013/253/5/3/foxy_ahri_by_artgerm-d6lqxo3.jpg

http://artgerm.deviantart.com/art/Janna-Poster-Art-407610100

Don't get me wrong. From an aesthetic point of view, the artists at Riot have done a phenomenal job (as with every splash art they release); however, I do feel like I'm not alone when I say that with the newest set of the splashes, I'm not the only individual who feels like some of the neweset splashes don't capture the "feel" of a familiar champion (because if they did, I don't think there would be so many people adusting the newest splashes on Lee Sin, Ahri, Etc.)

Here are my splash edits so far. I'll try to do other ones later:

http://i.imgur.com/ytl3nLkh.jpg

replies.body: I don't get this fuss around Ahri. Why can't you just accept it? I always thought she was supposed to be the most beautiful champion in League just cause of her theme. And in my opinion they nailed that in the new splash. She looks kinda dumbfounded/panicked in the tweaked pic as if she is being chased. Riot's version oozes out "come and get me" or "try to catch me, if you can ;)" kind of vibe which fits her theme better.

> I don't get this fuss around Ahri. Why can't you just accept it? I always thought she was supposed to be the most beautiful champion in League just cause of her theme. And in my opinion they nailed that in the new splash. She looks kinda dumbfounded/panicked in the tweaked pic as if she is being chased. Riot's version oozes out "come and get me" or "try to catch me, if you can ;)" kind of vibe which fits her theme better.

Because she WAS the most beautiful champ in the League. Then they completely changed the way she looks.
Well, beauty is in the eye of the beholder I guess...

It is which I feel is why pushing the same American beauty on a number of champs is scewing their original image. This is why players are drawn to certain splash arts. They fit a mold of beauty that isn't just another Americanized image. While ofc I like the new ahri splash I have to say that it loses that oriental beauty. There would have been a great way for them to make a new splash with an oriental beauty and still making her the most beautiful champ in the league. 

I think with Miss fortune around we don't really need much more American beauty. lol

Its nice to showcase that League isn't just one people. When you start to model all the new splashes off the same idea of beauty then you start to make league more bland. Its like another thread I posted in about the new Kayle splash. In making it more sexualized and defining kayle being a she you lose that essence of difference. You start making every female champ a sex symbol instead of a champion that they are. I think this is where the core of the issue comes from with the Ahri splash. While she is clearly beautiful she is just not the same. She isn't who she was defined as for so long. This in turn changes the entire view of ahri.

Well considering Ahri's theme, she should be the most sexualized champion in League (not in a vulgar way though) :P
The splash might not have as much "oriental beaty" as the old splash, but i'm fine with it. I can see the asian influence in her overall theme.
However if Riot somehow decided to create another Ahri splash where her face would be more asian and still retain that beauty/expression, I'd be ok with it. But between OP's tweaked edition of the splash and Riot's splash I'd say Riot's version fits Ahri better. And I think I already told why in my previous post.

I'd agree with this more if Ahri wasn't made as "the Korean champion." Her clothing is based on Korean garb, arguably all four of her other skins are distinctly Korean (Foxfire is questionable in this regard), her dance is based on one of the most popular Korean pop-groups (both base and Pop Star), and her name was based on a poll given specifically to the Korean playerbase in order to make sure Riot was appealing to them as well.

She was the Korean champion. Now she's white. Her facial structure is very clearly not Asian, and for me (and clearly others), this is a central problem with the updated splash art.

> I'd agree with this more if Ahri wasn't made as "the Korean champion." Her clothing is based on Korean garb, arguably all four of her other skins are distinctly Korean (Foxfire is questionable in this regard), her dance is based on one of the most popular Korean pop-groups (both base and Pop Star), and her name was based on a poll given specifically to the Korean playerbase in order to make sure Riot was appealing to them as well.
> 
> She was the Korean champion. Now she's white. Her facial structure is very clearly not Asian, and for me (and clearly others), this is a central problem with the updated splash art.

This. So much this.

As an Ahri player I'm unhappy with the new splash; she looks** far too pale...** and her features are way too soft and cutesy-ish/pink. Your edit on the other hand is absolutely glorious, and even highlights her ears more than the original one; something I hadn't thought was a problem before, but find to be much better after seeing it here...
As for Janna (who I also play occasionally) I can see how the new splash is... very different, almost themed minimalistic facially... compared to the old one. Not exactly in a good way. And I will admit that while I own and quite like news reporter Janna, it's not the same face as the original Janna splash (or the new one for that matter) though in all fairness, she's in a different pose, moving towards the point of view, and having to look over her glasses which have been blown by the wind.

Shame the new Ahri splash looks so... different. Almost like some kind of creepy doll; though admittedly I'm biased. At the very least I play using Midnight Ahri.

They also changed Janna's body type: she now has a longer torso, which is contorted into a spine-unfriendly position. I think her legs got lengthened too. Oh Riot, please don't swap her splash, it was better than most of the new ones.

She's in the same position as she was before actually. She's also got for the most part the same legs and torso, as far as I can tell...
If anything, the new Janna splash is **almost** an improved version of her old one. Except that the facial features are all completely wrong, like as if it's a different person altogether.

Just my opinion though.
I love that janna pic at the bottom, so good.

I do not get what people has against new Ahri and Janna splashes.

Both are gorgeous. 

You are talking about old splash like it is the thing that determines the champion and new splash should be just enhanced version of that.

What determines a chmapion are it's: 3D model, Skills, ingame audio and Lore.
Then you talk about generic faces. It seems to me that pictures you posted (from Artgerm) are ven more generic.

Though Lee is different story. I do not completely agree with composition, but I acknowledge it's high quality execution. And that is enough for me.

It almost seems that people are against any changes.

the new Janna one looks WAAAAY better than the old one, it actually feels like a wind sorceress because of the slimmer look. the old one didn't do her any justice and was one of the uglier splashes in my opinion. The new one makes her far more graceful and serene, without feeling so weighed down as the old one.

The reason everyone is complaining about Ahri's is because her face looks different. Everything else looks fine to me and is really well done. The only thing that they didn't do quite right is that her face looks very anglicized, and doesn't keep the original authentic Korean look that it was supposed to have. The reason this is a big deal to a lot of players is that she is basically THE Korean champion (she is based on a character from their mythology and was released to commemorate the launch of the Korean server).

Ahri never was nnd never will be Korean champion for me. 

Yes she has roots in their mythology, but so does Nasus or Pantheon and no one blinks and eye for their updates.

> Ahri never was nnd never will be Korean champion for me. 
> 
> Yes she has roots in their mythology, but so does Nasus or Pantheon and no one blinks and eye for their updates.

Ahri shall forever and ever be a Korean-inspired, Korean-ethnic, Korean-named, Honor-for-Korea-Servers Champion though.

And regarding Nasus and Pantheon:

Nasus is based on Anubis. Nasus still matches well with what makes Anubis look like Anubis.

Pantheon is based on a Spartan Hoplite, mixed with a Rettari. As far as I can tell, he's always conveyed these looks very well.

Ahri not being Korean is like Sejuani without a mace or Bristles / Kevin. Like Vladimir not holding a volume of blood. Like Graves not having a shotgun. Like Twisted Fate not throwing cards. Like Zac not being made of goo. Like Orianna without her ball. Like Riven without her broken blade.

It just doesn't capture the feel well enough of Ahri, not the feel that the original splash and kit give. It's more west and less east, but part of Ahri's character is to be east. So... She kind of needs to be east, and this new splash removes that part of her.

:|

ok lets say that she "needs" to have korean look. (which I strongly disagree)

The old one also did not had it. She just got too much of a thick lashes.

> ok lets say that she "needs" to have korean look. (which I strongly disagree)
> 
> The old one also did not had it. She just got too much of a thick lashes.

Because she had thick lashes she didn't look Korean?

Because she had lashes that were too thick she didn't look Asian? What the actual fuck?

Wat?

New Ahri does not look korean.
Old Ahri did not look korean.

That is my point.

> Wat?
> 
> New Ahri does not look korean.
> Old Ahri did not look korean.
> 
> That is my point.

Bullshit.

I know an Asian girl who, with little/no makeup, looks strikingly similar.

She does, in fact, bear resemblance to someone Oriental.

> ok lets say that she "needs" to have korean look. (which I strongly disagree)
> 
> The old one also did not had it. She just got too much of a thick lashes.

Fashion trend in Korea: Absolute ridiculous over-fluffing of the eyelashes. HMMMMMM.

Additionally, this is a standard practice to emphasize somebody's eyes in a drawing so that it stays on the correct sides of the uncanny valley.

I'll give you that Janna's new splash is gorgeous, and in many ways improving upon the original splash (apart from the face, which is structurally different).
Ahri's splash however, while very nicely done, isn't Ahri. Just my extremely biased opinion.

> I'll give you that Janna's new splash is gorgeous, and in many ways improving upon the original splash (apart from the face, which is structurally different).
> Ahri's splash however, while very nicely done, isn't Ahri. Just my extremely biased opinion.

I think that opinion is a fact :o none of the facial features/shapes match. It now looks like a complete different person and her skins don't even go or match with her anymore. Gj Riot.
Oh I totally agree about Ahri, she definitely looks pretty and the art is amazing, but it isn't Ahri. Heck, even the video they did a month or so ago had Ahri look more like Ahri.
keep ahri's original splash kthx {{champion:103}}

It bothers me that Ahri doesn't even look remotely like 'herself' anymore. She's pretty unique in being visually identifiable as Asian. The new splash art makes it seem like an entirely different champion, really. It doesn't match any of her other skins, either. I bought all of Ahri's skins and really enjoy how different they are yet how you can still identify her in each one.  I feel pretty disappointed that they plan on doing...this...to her.

I love you. This was exactly what I was thinking, there's nothing wrong with how Ahri looked Asain when there are clearly other ethnicities in game as well.  How they're all of a sudden trying to change who she is, is a no no. About the skins too, yeah. They look like they're not meant for her because she almost looks like a whole other person now. I hope this gets noticed. I miss old Ahri already, why ;-:

Ahri = alright as is. No need for Splash Update.

Janna = also alright. The original also seems ok as it is.

Lee Sin = feel bad for the guy. yet don't see much bad in the new image if we use the one fixed.

Vladimir = yep, they got that one. and rumble and veigar also seem better in their new images.
Janna needed one, ahri didnt really need one but both are good, lee sin's is alright.

Ehh, I can go for her original splash, the new one and your edit. The only thing I'm confused about is why she and Janna got new splashes anyway. They didn't need them like Shen or Singed did.

As a artist, they all look fine to me.
Janna's looked outdated and kinda sucked compared to all the new ones, she kinda needed it, ahri probably didnt, but the new ahri splash art i like more than the new one.
i really LOVE the new splashes especially janna ,well that's only my opinion i guess

I also really love the new splashes and the Janna one.   But the old one was also good, and this is where the problem arises: in my opinion a new splash should always be undeniably way better than the old one in most aspects, and as you can see a lot of people are fond of the old lee sin/wu kong/ahri/janna ones - I think they were all made by the same artist, and all of those are solid; maybe the art style might look a bit outdated, but not a HUGE amount like the blitz/shen/shaco/udyr/taric etc. - THOSE were fugly, the other ones aren't, so either the new ones have to be way way better or you're always gonna get people who are not satisfied.  

Like in the lee sin/wu kong/ahri/janna ones you could have just painted over the originals to increase the edge sharpness and quality, and added new lighting/effects, without necessarily altering the color/anatomy/pose, and you probably would have near 100% satisfaction in the population.  

I love the quality of the new splash arts and I love that one artist's style (guy who did shen/ori and I believe has done a lot of the other ones like cait/heimer/talon - might be more than one artist but with similar style) so it'd be nice if all the splash artists looked like his/her style, but not necessarily a new pose/color.
Your Ahri is way better than this new splash art *o*
But many more of them are SO good. I think they've shown a ton more good than bad with these. (Ezreal, Singed, J4, Blitz, Udyr, Veigar, Shaco, Talon)

Also, the new splash has clothing that seems to conform to her body, she still has the thing (Unless the lore team decides to fix what ain't broke again.) where she does not like wearing clothes, so her clothes shouldn't be hugging her like that.

She looks like one of the plastic surgery ridden Chinese models now.

Yeah, I agree with you, especially ahri, but I really like the other changes (Rumble, Singed, Veigar, etc) except shaco, his face looks like a plastic mask all flattened

~~LET THE DOWNVOTES COMMENCE~~

I just feel that Ahri and Janna look incredibly...neutral. Which doesn't really make any sense for either of them? I mean, maybe Janna, you can make the case that she's 'the calm hiding the storm' or something, but Ahri is playful and flirty in all of her VAs. There's no reason for her to be that bland.

artgerm's art is great.  but what is with that foot...?  sometimes i wonder if artists avoid drawing feet because they don't get enough practice drawing them and don't want them to look ugly...which just perpetuates a vicious cycle.
I really think the problem with Ahri new splash art is the hair, it is shorter and puffy around the face. While the old one its long and straight. (shorter ears too) inb4 missing tassel.

art looks fine to me
Kind of hard to get fantasy art "wrong" honestly.
Lee's splash is fine. People think he is midair, in the middle of Resonating Strike, but he isn't. He is looking at the post he just kicked into pieces. His head is positioned correctly.

> Lee's splash is fine. People think he is midair, in the middle of Resonating Strike, but he isn't. He is looking at the post he just kicked into pieces. His head is positioned correctly.

HE

IS

BLIND.

HE SHOULD NOT BE LOOKING AT THE POST HE JUST KICKED, HIS EAR SHOULD BE TURNED TO IT.
Nowhere, but actions speak louder than words

The hairstyle is the only thing that looks less asian to me honnestly. so I'll assume you're just making stuff up about that point. 

No offense, but if your only proof is "look at the picture", the picture's not enough to prove your point to me.

I wonder why thye change it  tought. Old one was still pretty nicely done.
Now that I look at it, her new face is slightly obscured by her hair. so that it looks like her face is less round. Maybe that's it.
Her eyes are shaped differently, and while we can't see the cheek anymore, the chin is definitely more pronounced and sharper. And yeah, hairstyle.

Holy FUCK that Ahri splash that you made was incredible.

But yeah, what Vaffany said. I just want her to be, well, her.
Rito u rooned Ahre splash {{champion:103}}
I also Hope riot adds the bell to her clothing on the chest on her new splash art.. while the in game has a sound effect of the bell when shes dancing and shows it on her.
I think ahri's face is a little out of shape and Janna's neck is too long... Sh looks like an old lady now and it kinda kills the mood :|
